triples.evidence: techniques such as incremental step pulse programming (ISPP), multi-level cells (MLC), triple-level cells (TLC) and even quad-level cells (QLC) have been widely applied to mass production.
cell-to-cell interference obviously exists during the cell ‘programming’ configuration in 3D NAND flash.
a novel 3D NAND structure containing a vacuum dielectric inside of the ILD was newly proposed. The cell-to-cell program interference was reduced by aid of the proposed device structure.
cell-to-cell interference increases with the slope of 91 mV/nm because of increased parasitic capacitance between the WLs.

mappings.label: TLC
mappings.notes: TLC is explicitly mentioned in the paper as a type of cell used in NAND flash.

mappings.label: Cell-to-Cell Interference
mappings.notes: Interference is a logical issue related to firmware and logic.

mappings.label: Inter-layer Dielectric (ILD)
mappings.notes: ILD is a physical component affecting interference.

mappings.label: Vacuum Dielectric
mappings.notes: Vacuum dielectric is a proposed physical modification to reduce interference.

paper_original_filename: Dielectric Engineering to Suppress Cell-to-Cell Interference in 3D NAND Flash Memory..pdf
